Package org.northcoder.titlewebdemo.controller

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.northcoder.titlewebdemo.controller.Controller
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContentTypeController, TalentController, TalentInTitleController, TitleController
    public abstract class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    The bridge between specific bean controllers and the generic data access object.

    • Method Detail

      • fetchOneRecord

        public static <T extends DemoBean> DaoData<T> fetchOneRecord​(T bindParams,
                                                             java.lang.String sql)
        Selects one record from the database, using the record's unique identifier (primary key).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of bean being selected
        Parameters:
        bindParams - a bean containing all null fields except for the unique identifier field
        sql - the select statement to be executed
        Returns:
        the result set (expected to be a single bean)

      • fetchAllRecords

        public static <T extends DemoBean> DaoData<T> fetchAllRecords​(T bindParams,
                                                              java.lang.String sql)
        Selects a set of records from the database.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of beans being selected
        Parameters:
        bindParams - typically, an empty bean with no database bind parameters, if all data is being selected.
        sql - the select statement
        Returns:
        a collection of beans representing the SQL result set

      • updateOneRecord

        public static <T extends DemoBean> DaoData<T> updateOneRecord​(java.lang.String formBody,
                                                              java.lang.String updateSql,
                                                              T bean)
        Updates one record in the database.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of bean being updated
        Parameters:
        formBody - the raw contents of the HTML form, as submitted by the user
        updateSql - the SQL update statement for the type of bean being updated
        bean - an empty bean into which the raw form data will be loaded
        Returns:
        the updated record, upon successful completion of the SQL update; or, the original form data plus error messages, if there were any form validation errors or database errors.
